| A chiropteran mummy:* can [survive underwater](/wiki/Amphibious "Amphibious").
* [does not breathe](/wiki/Breathless "Breathless").
* is [mindless](/wiki/Mindless "Mindless").
* is [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") to eat.
* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* wanders randomly.
* has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless").
* resists death magic.
* does not naturally [regenerate](/wiki/Regenerate "Regenerate") HP. |                                                                                                          |

A **chiropteran mummy**, M, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). It is a mummified [chiropteran](/wiki/Chiropteran "Chiropteran") that is the only non-[humanoid](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid") [mummy](/wiki/Mummy "Mummy") in the monster class.

A chiropteran mummy has four strong claw attacks. They also inflict [curses](/wiki/Mummy_curse "Mummy curse") on the player character upon death like most other mummies.

## Encyclopedia entry

But for an account of the manner in which the body was  
bandaged, and a list of the unguents and other materials  
employed in the process, and the words of power which were  
spoken as each bandage was laid in its place, we must have  
recourse to a very interesting papyrus which has been edited  
and translated by M. Maspero under the title of Le Rituel de  
l'Embaumement. ...  
Everything that could be done to preserve the body was now  
done, and every member of it was, by means of the words of  
power which changed perishable substances into imperishable,  
protected to all eternity; when the final covering of purple  
or white linen had been fastened upon it, the body was ready  
for the tomb.

\[ Egyptian Magic, by E.A. Wallis Budge ]

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Chiropteran_mummy\&action=edit)*

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Chiropteran mummy

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
M chiropteran mummy (No tile)
Difficulty 10
Attacks Claw 4d10 physical, Claw 4d10 physical, Claw 4d4 physical, Claw 4d4 physical, Passive 0d0 inflict curses
M chiropteran mummy (No tile)
Difficulty 10
Attacks

Claw 4d10 physical, Claw 4d10 physical, Claw 4d4 physical, Claw 4d4 physical, Passive 0d0 inflict curses

Base level 7
Base experience 134
Speed 12
Base AC 4
Base MR 30
Alignment -6 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 3000
Nutritional value 175
Size large
Resistances cold, sleep, poison

A chiropteran mummy:

  • can survive underwater.
  • does not breathe.
  • is mindless.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is undead.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • wanders randomly.
  • has infravision.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • resists death magic.
  • does not naturally regenerate HP.

A chiropteran mummy, M, is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack. It is a mummified chiropteran that is the only non-humanoid mummy in the monster class.

A chiropteran mummy has four strong claw attacks. They also inflict curses on the player character upon death like most other mummies.

Encyclopedia entry

But for an account of the manner in which the body was
bandaged, and a list of the unguents and other materials
employed in the process, and the words of power which were
spoken as each bandage was laid in its place, we must have
recourse to a very interesting papyrus which has been edited
and translated by M. Maspero under the title of Le Rituel de
l'Embaumement. ...
Everything that could be done to preserve the body was now
done, and every member of it was, by means of the words of
power which changed perishable substances into imperishable,
protected to all eternity; when the final covering of purple
or white linen had been fastened upon it, the body was ready
for the tomb.

[ Egyptian Magic, by E.A. Wallis Budge ]
This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

A '''chiropteran mummy''', {{blue|M}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]]. It is a mummified [[chiropteran]] that is the only non-[[humanoid]] [[mummy]] in the monster class.

A chiropteran mummy has four strong claw attacks. They also inflict [[mummy curse|curses]] on the player character upon death like most other mummies.

==Encyclopedia entry==
{{encyclopedia|
But for an account of the manner in which the body was
bandaged, and a list of the unguents and other materials
employed in the process, and the words of power which were
spoken as each bandage was laid in its place, we must have
recourse to a very interesting papyrus which has been edited
and translated by M. Maspero under the title of Le Rituel de
l'Embaumement. ...
Everything that could be done to preserve the body was now
done, and every member of it was, by means of the words of
power which changed perishable substances into imperishable,
protected to all eternity; when the final covering of purple
or white linen had been fastened upon it, the body was ready
for the tomb.
|[ Egyptian Magic, by E.A. Wallis Budge ]
